üìö Study Material - Today in History (Feb 15) & Cultural Heritage

This study material covers significant historical milestones, scientific pioneers, and the architectural heritage of India‚Äôs most sacred temples, which are frequently asked in Static GK sections.

üöÄ Science & Space Milestones:

  • ISRO's World Record (2017): On Feb 15, India launched 104 satellites using PSLV-C37, demonstrating global leadership in space technology.
  • Galileo Galilei: Born today in 1564, known as the 'Father of Modern Science' for his work in observational astronomy and physics.

üèõÔ∏è Temple Architecture & Culture:

  • Kalinga Architecture: Exemplified by the Lingaraj Temple (Odisha). It is a sub-style of Nagara architecture featuring the Deula (sanctum) and Jagamohana (assembly hall).
  • Mahakaleshwar (Ujjain): The only 'Dakshinamukhi' (South-facing) Jyotirlinga. Famous for the unique Bhasma Aarti.
  • Jyotirlingas in India: There are 12 total. Maharashtra holds the maximum (3), while Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat hold 2 each.

üìú Modern History & Literature:

  • Mirza Ghalib: The legendary Urdu poet of the Mughal court (contemporary of Bahadur Shah Zafar) who passed away on this day in 1869.
  • Fall of Singapore (1942): A critical WWII event that eventually led to the formation of the Indian National Army (INA) by Indian Prisoners of War.

Important Topics for Exams:

  • ISRO Space Missions (PSLV vs GSLV)
  • Temple Architecture Styles (Nagara, Dravida, Kalinga)
  • 12 Jyotirlingas and their States/Rivers
  • Prominent figures of the 1857 Revolt (Mirza Ghalib context)
